sentences.en: A little electric tingle seemed to run up my spine.
sentences.cn: 一股电流似乎穿过了我的脊柱.

sentences.en: But he feels only a familiar tingle, and then he is through.
sentences.cn: 但他只感觉一阵儿熟悉的麻刺感, 然后他就进去了.

sentences.en: Chang Su - su felt a tingle of excitement , and her heart began thumping wildly.
sentences.cn: 张素素觉得全身的血都涌上来, 心是直跳.

sentences.en: I felt a sudden tingle of excitement.
I get a tingle even now whenever I see them being replayed.
sentences.cn: 每当我看见它们被重播,我就会感到一阵兴奋.

sentences.en: I still get a tingle of anticipation down my spine.
sentences.cn: 的短信时,我仍会在脊背上一激灵,满是期待.

sentences.en: I tingle where I sat in the nettles.
sentences.cn: 我坐过在荨麻上的那个部位觉得刺痛.

sentences.en: My body tingled all over and I had a terrible headache.

sentences.cn: 我的良心开始感到刺痛[不安].

sentences.en: My girlfriend's promise to marry me made my tingle.
sentences.cn: 我女朋友答应与我结婚使我大为激动.

sentences.en: She feels a tingle of excitement.
The cold air made her face tingle.
sentences.cn: 冷空气冻得她的脸发痛。

sentences.en: The cold caused a tingle in my ears.
sentences.cn: 严寒使我的耳朵有刺痛之感.

sentences.en: The cold caused a tingle in my fingers.
sentences.cn: 严寒使我的手指有刺痛感.

sentences.en: The music made my blood tingle.
When I look over and see Terry I tingle all over.
sentences.cn: 当我放眼望去见到特里时，我整个人兴奋不已。

trans.tran_en: if a part of your body tingles, you feel a slight stinging feeling, especially on your skin

trans.tran_cn: 感到刺痛，引起刺痛，（耳朵等）鸣响
